page.title: 09Dale Fort Field Centre
page.content: Dale Fort(G.R. SM(12) 823 052) was built as part of the Milford Haven fortification in 1856.It is built of thick blocks of limestone and granite and is partly dug into the cliffs.It is now used as a Field Studies Centre accommodating about 90 students.There are 3 teaching and about 8 domestic/ secretarial staff.Most of the students are doing A-level work and come to do fieldwork in marine biology.There are labs and workrooms at the Fort for observing specimens etc.Other students come to study or do research on some aspect of ecology.Courses are also run for amateurs on archaeology,diving, birdwatching etc.The Fort has its own boat,the Lord Hurcombe used for taking students to the offshore islands.It is also a climatological weather station, recording sunshine,rainfall, temperature,windspeed etc.
